name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
setup: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Extend one leg straight out in line with other thigh
Arms at sides or across chest
steps: Drive through heel of planted foot to lift hips
Squeeze glute of working leg to extend hips fully
Keep hips level (don't let them rotate or drop to one side)
Pause 1s at top with full glute contraction
Lower under control to just above floor
Complete all reps on one side, then switch
mistakes: Hips rotating or tilting to one side
Pushing through toes instead of heel
Hyperextending lower back instead of using glutes
Cutting range short (not reaching full hip extension)
safety: If lower back feels it, focus on glute engagement and avoid excessive arch. Keep hips level to prevent asymmetrical loading.

regressions: Eccentric-only single-leg bridge (lower slow, reset with both feet)
progressions: Weighted single-leg bridge (dumbbell or barbell on hips)
Single-leg hip thrust (shoulders elevated on bench)

prescriptionHints.notes: Great for glute activation and unilateral strength. Focus on quality and control over reps.

joints.notes: Keep hips level to avoid compensatory patterns. Avoid hyperextension by focusing on glute contraction.
